GeneralExplanationGrp.IdentifierTxt: STANDARDS GOVERNING GRANTS BY RICHARD AND RUTH LAVINE FAMILY FOUNDATION
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: 1. GRANTS MAY BE MADE TO ANY CHARITABLE, TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION WHICH IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, AS AMENDED. NO GRANTS SHALL BE MADE, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, TO INDIVIDUALS OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS.2. GRANTS SHALL BE MADE ONLY FOR RELIGIOUS, CHARITABLE, SCIENTIFIC, LITERARY OR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES, OR FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO CHILDREN OR ANIMALS.3. AS CONDITION OF THE GRANT, THE CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION MUST PROVIDE THE FOUNDATION WITH SATISFACTORY EVIDENCE THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS AN ELIGIBLE ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPH 1.4. GRANTS MAY BE MADE BY THE FOUNDATION EITHER ON THE BASIS OF APPLICATIONS BY PROSPECTIVE GRANTEES OR WITHOUT APPLICATION UPON APPROVAL OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES.
